alert.note: Alert for Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 17 at 2:10PM CDT until May 17 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 210 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Jackson, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Clarke County. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
